reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Harvey's for 2 nts and were very pleased with our 9th flr lake view room. The room was very spacious and the views were fabulous! A note to Harvey's...hey guys, get with the program....charging $9.95 a day for Wi-Fi service??? As if you don't make enough $$$ from your casinos??? Tacky!!!
reviews.title: Great location & room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay in Tahoe every year for our anniversary. Mostly we stay at Harvey's - Though we noticed a decline in the hotel/casino since Harrah's purchased this hotel. This visit was much better than previous years. We arrived after midnight Friday night (as we advised during our orig reservation and called again that day to remind them). We were told they overbooked by 90 rooms and advised us they would put us ap at Embassy Suites across the street for no charge and credit our room for the first night. (Previous years when overbooked, they would offer us Holiday Inn or other motel farther down the road). We weren't really thrilled or happy about it, why get upset and ruin our weekend. We were tired and just wanted to sleep. They promised us an early checkin back at Harveys as well as a non smoking room. They offered to take all our luggage to ES at once and did so promptly. In the morning, we called the bell service at Harveys, advised them we needed someone to get our luggage at ES and take to Harveys, they arrived within minutes and took our luggage to our room at Harveys. The people at checkin were wonderful, they even gave us a Lake Tower room with a gorgeous view of the lake on the 15th floor (we paid for the lower inexpensive floor). the room was very clean, normally when we return home, our unused clothes smell of smoke - but that was not the case this time. The bed was a uncomfortable and could stand for replacing with some really good mattresses. The Sports Room charged us for drinks and waters while we were betting and watching a Baseball Game- the waitress said they charge after 6pm- the group of young guys next to us were extremely upset- we just didn't order anything further. The Hard Rock Cafe Bar charged us 3 different prices for the exact same drinks (all in a single night). Noone could actually give us a good explanation as to why? One bartender that charged us the most, didn't give us change from our 2 drink order- thinking he was being tipped $4 for 2 drinks.... My husband put him straight then didn't tip him at all.(Normally we tip $1 per drink) Once we found out drinks were cheaper than what he was charging, my husband was not at all happy (that bartender was gone for night). All in all, we found Harveys was better than it has been last 2-3 years but not up to what it was before buyout. We will return again next year and hope things continue to get better.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — View, Service from Front Desk/Maid Service/Valet/Bell Serv

reviews.text: Good location, brand new renovations, nice decorations. Much more better than the hotels in Las Vegas. Bad things are - self parking, which mixed with the public parking, difficult to find a good spot close to hotels. You have to pay to use Internet. No coffee maker and refrigerator. Anyway would stay again next time.
reviews.title: Five Stars Hotel

likes.disliked: — Parking, no coffee maker, fees on internet and fitness.

reviews.text: We stayed at Harvey's South Lake Tahoe over Memorial Day weekend. We stayed in room #549 (Classic Room) on the Mountain View floor. We had a beautiful view of Heavenly! The room was recently renovated and very nice. The pictures on Harvey's website are accurate. Our room was right next to the elevator, but there was never a problem with noise from the elevator traffic. We ate at Hard Rock (Harvey's) and Cabo Wabo (Harrah's). Both were excellent. There is also a Starbucks and Cinnabon...YUM!! Our only complaints are that the walls were very thin (we could hear our neighbors until about 2am) and there is a $10 per person charge to use the gym (we checked the gym out and there wasn't anything special to justify paying this amount). There is a $10.95 charge for wi-fi access in your room. Harvey's is in walking distance to many great activities. The hotel has a tunnel connecting Harvey's to Harrah's. It's just a few minute walk to Bill's Casino (smoke free), the Marriott for great shopping, movie theater, Raley's (grocery store), and Heavenly. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice stay.

reviews.text: The hotel iteself is a good value for the money. It's located in the center of the casinos in Lake Tahoe. Good views of the lake. The rooms looked to be recently renovated and clean. The beds were comfortable. Overall, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I, just wanted to "get away". So we booked a 19th floor, premium room for one night! We arrived on Thursday afternoon, check in was very fast and friendly the room was gourgues with amazing views of lake Tahoe and the Mountains. I could not believe $119.00 for the night, the next day the same room would go for over $400.00. Very quite, no out side noise at all. We enjoyed the comedy show at the Improv. The entire staff were friendly, we could not have had a better time! We did this "trip" on a minuets notice. We plan on doing this get a way every other month now, just to break up the every day routine. I recommend Harvey's to everyone, and it wont break the bank! Unless You let it. LOL 04/17/08
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in a Superior room, the room was huge and had a wonderful view. I believe we were in an unfurnished room however it was still furnished tastefully and in good condition. We found the service helpful and reception very friendly. We had relatives stay here as well and they had a mix up with there room booking however reception did fix the problem straight away they had a refurbished room. Our stay was for the sking and loved sking Heavenly we hired our skis from the ski shop in the hotel and utilised the complimentary shuttle from the hotel to the gondola base every day. I also used the day spa for a massage however it was situated in Harrahs. We ate at the hotel either the Hard rock Cafe or the Mexican restaurant meals were great, we also recommend the food court at Harrahs. We had breakfast every morning in the cafe off Harveys casino floor they have a special deal $9.99 for buffet inc coffee, juice (great if you like scrambled eggs).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I called Harrah's Rewards card number to book a room there and even though the website said there were rooms available, they told us on the phone that there were none available but if we were willing to stay at Harvey's, they would comp our rooms. So of course we gratefully accepted it. We stayed in a luxury room on the 12th floor. The room looked old, but it appeared clean and was very spacious. It had a nice view of the lake and a sitting area where you could enjoy the view. The bathroom had 3 separate areas: A tub and shower area, toilet, and vanity area. They all could be separated by doors so it is great if you have a few people getting ready at the same time. The bed was not comfortable at all. It was too soft. Overall, I can't complain about the room since it was free. I would stay again if I got a deal for less that $100 per night for that room. Harvey's Casino had decent gambling and it is connected to Harrahs, so it is easy to go through the underground passageway to check it out. The one thing that I did not like about Harvey's was the restaurants. We tried their coffee shop, (Choices, I think it was called.) They advertised it as if it were a place that you could get healthy options, but we did not see any on the menu. The food was terrible, and it was just your basic breakfast which should not be hard to mess up in my opinion. We also tried the steakhouse, and we were very disappointed. The server was rude, the food took forever, it was not very tasty, and it was very expensive. We had better meals for much less at Josh's Steakhouse in the Horizon Casino and also in the nice restaurant on the 19th? floor of Harrah's. (Try the breakfast there. Beautiful view and interesting menu items.) I would stay in Harvey's again probably but I would not eat in their restaurants.
reviews.title: We got a great deal at Harvey's
Excellent Everything!!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at Harveys from april 3rd thru april 7th.The room lake tower 8th floor was beautiful with breathtaking views.The service was superb.The casino was great and not too smoky.comedy show at the improv was hillarious and dinner at the sage room was awesome.I cant say enough great things about our stay.We skied heavenly which was good except not much for the rookie skier.Pretty much no green hills except easy street(bunny hill).if your a good skier and like a challenge you will love heavenly.Don't use the ski delivery service.They were very nice and priced well. But, then you have to carry your equipment back and forth from the hotel to the gondola (about 2 blocks in the wind and cold) Better to rent your skis right at the bottom of the gondola and put them in a locker overnight for $2.00.We have found our new favorite winter vacation spot.

reviews.title: What a grand place !
reviews.text: We were booked at Harrah's in a deluxe room, arrived late at Lake Tahoe and were greeted politely at 1 AM. The room we were assigned had a left over stale cigarette smell, it was very faint as the room was very clean, however we insisted on a non smoking room and were transfered across the street to Harvey's. ( both are owned by the same company). This room was like a large condo. Upstair floor, corner room with wrapped around windows over looking the Lake and Sierra Nevada. It had 2 bath-rooms, living-room with a spacious dining room, full northern balcony, total privacy, thick carpeting, bath-robes, 2 flat large TV etc... Decor was muted and in good taste. We did not close the drapes and the morning light dancing on the pristine lake woke us. Thank-you Harrah's and Harvey's for running such great hotels. We also had lunch on the top floor of Harrah's buffet style and quite nice. Our stay was Thursday 20th March 2008. The help we received from your night shift staff was superb.
From the moment I arrived to the moment I left (unwillingly) this hotel/casino experience was great.
reviews.title: Great Stay. I'm coming back soon...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reservations:
reviews.title: Great if you can get a deal!

likes.disliked: — No in-room coffee maker, the old man feel about the casino.

reviews.text: I originally intended to try and book a ski vacation through another website but found I could get a much better deal over the phone b/c a Harvey's reservation agent was able to put together a package (3 nights + 4 lift tix and then 1 xtra night at regular cost) that was $200 less than the other "deal" I was going to get.
reviews.title: Good room, fantastic bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival:
reviews.title: Cheap, renovated, but totally tacky & trashy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We pulled up and although it took a few minutes, the valet came and took our car and the bellman took our luggage. Check-in was fast and we were given a room on the 6th floor. Bell services took only 5 minutes to bring our luggage to the room.
reviews.title: Never stay here again!!!

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel at 10:30 pm after an 8 hour drive with 2 small kids and a friend in tow, with 2 non-smoking room reservations made months before. I asked the receptionist, Adriana from South Lake Tahoe, if we could stay in the Mountain Tower. Without checking or bothering to look at me she said “No the hotel is full.” When we got up to the room we found we were on a smoking floor, of which there are only 2 on a total of 25. I called down to say we did not want a smoking room. Adriana put me on hold and did not come back to the phone. We all had to go back down to hear her say the hotel was full. She said just because we requested a non-smoking room that was no guarantee we would get one. I asked to speak to the manager. She went inside a door to the back office. She came back 10 minutes later and said the manager was out. She did not suggest checking back the next day to see if anything came up. She couldn’t care less. I noticed there was a steady stream of guests checking in after us and they were not being assigned the smoking floors but we were too tired to kick up a fuss at that point. I did manage to talk to a manager the next day and she told me: “This hotel is run by the players. If you request a room months back and some players come in today and want your room we’re going to give it to them.” This was told to me by Tara, the "Front Office Shift Manager". Evidently thre hotel manager is only available to “players”. The room itself was minimal, no writing desk, no stationery, no information folder or magazines, no fridge, no coffee maker, no armchair, no counter top or anyplace at all to put your wallet and keys, but there is a tip envelope for the room maid. Some nice touches – the 3 fan settings and temp control on the room thermostat don’t do anything. Fiddle around as you might. You have no effect. You are overridden. In the elevators the “Door Close” button doesn’t do anything. You are overridden. The lobby is full of screaming tweens and swearing, yelling teens. The room above sounded like a bull stampede nightly between 11 and midnight without fail. The room behind our beds had drunk fighting guys who were considerate enough to take their altercation behind the closed doors of their room, not knowing that the walls separating us were paper thin. This hotel and its front office staff are an unmitigated nightmare from beginning to end.
reviews.title: Brutally Rude And Unprofessional

likes.disliked: — The front office staff, the rooms, the facilities, the food, the noise, the universal rudeness.

reviews.text: One of the best spas anywhere. Great service and so so rooms.
reviews.title: GREAT SPA beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is not that much to do in Tahoe but they have everything that there is
reviews.title: Great Customer Service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Harveys for snowboarding/gambling trip the end of Feb. We had a Mountain Tower room that was clean but small with no view of the mtns or lakes but was great for the money. We booked through Harrahs.com using TR and got a greal deal. Food was ok, we ate at Hard Rocks and the cafe and were not overly impressed with either. We were impressed with the buffet at Harrahs, great food and wonderful view!!
reviews.title: Pleasant Resort Casino Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Customer service was excellent at both properties. I feel like I was comparing this trip with many others to Vegas and I must say the service in Tahoe was much better!! From CW to dealers to concierge I felt like the staff at Harrahs in Tahoe had much better custiomer service training than in Vegas.
reviews.title: Excellent!
